chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad P. Hoffstatter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.

Defendant shall have no contact with C.G.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to C.G. due within 30 days and preapproved by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: The costs are to be reduced to a civil judgment.  The costs are added to defendant's current payment plan.

The jail sentence is to begin immediately.  Good time is granted. 

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Defendant Chad P. Hoffstatter in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Chad P. Hoffstatter in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Plea of no contest to the amended charge.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea colloquy.   Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Nocco.  Court orders withheld sentence probation for one year; court costs; DNA surcharge and sample; no contact with victim C.G.; letter of apology to C.G. due within 30 days and preapproved by probation.  - rt

Defendant Chad P. Hoffstatter in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Chad P. Hoffstatter in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Waiver found to be given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently. Based on waiver, Court bound DE over for trial. Information filed by State. DE waived further reading of same and entered a plea of not guilty. Plea colloquy. Pretrial conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:15 a.m. Notices given to parties. DE requested a bond reduction. Objection by DA. Court denied bond reduction. ap
